name: FluvialGeomorphologyToolbox
tagline: A toolbox to extract data organized along a spatial continuum.
body:
The ArcGIS Fluvial Geomorphology toolbox comprises 15 Python scripts including ‘Create Transects, ‘Moving Window’, ‘Local Moving Window’ and ‘Distance Along Line (DAL)’ that each generate respective sets of geometrical or tabular outputs to analyse spatial continuums.

This toolbox was presented at the 2014 Northwest GIS User Conference, in Lynnwood, WA.

Here is an example of what the tools require as inputs and what they can output:



Performed on the Magpie river, ON in order to assess the impact of hydro-dams on river morphology and habitat.


List of tools included in FluvialGeormorphologyToolbox:
1. AzimuthCalculation
2. BioPatchesLengthsCalculator
3. Create Transects
4. CrossSections to Points
5. Extract Patches Values
6. LocalMovingWindow (LMW)
7. MovingWindow (MW)
8. PatchesNames
9. Points Inside Polygon
10. Polygon to Points
11. RasterSubstraction
12. Distance along Line (DAL)
13. SelectionTool
14. ShoreMaker
15. TransectsDAL

Download the toolbox and add it to your map in ArcMap 10.X. Check the 'READ_ME_PythonCodeInstructions.txt' file for more information. Contact me if you have any questions.
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
